text: I have an assignment coming up involving me making a presentation about the career path I want to follow. This involves me asking a few questions someone within the industry. Is it okay for me to ask you about 8 questions to help me out? as well do you have a website or a showreel you're able to show me of yours?

yeah that would be no bother at all thats kinda the whole point of this thing :slightly_smiling_face: showreel - <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j1bq5n3HWAU>         portfolio - <https://www.artstation.com/rooboy3d>

attachments.title: Roo MacNeill 2018 Demoreel

text: great! so I'm gonna ask you the questions one by one and, not serious questions but just some for some information. first question, What are some of the basic routines you go through when entering your job on a basis? Any quick warm up short work, straight into major projects, file check ups? anything that you could think of - even saying you start with 15 minute coffee break counts :blush:

first 15 mins, come in grab a tea , say hello to everyone, open up and check any emails, check last night renders to see if there us anything from yesterday that needs fixed before todays tasks, pop my headphones on and get into it . my schedule is laid out around a month in advance so i dont have to plan a day or over think anything
nice! okay, so. next question would be - what is the most enjoyable part of your job for you? (can be more than one)

the most enjoyable part is when you got watch the film you have been working on with people who know nothing about it ( as we get a bit numb to looking at it after working on it for a year + ) and seeing the reactions of people to things you have made

having people wonder how certain things are made in movies which you worked on must feel great. Andd the next question would be - Whats the biggest issue you encounter in the job? crashing, file corruption, undecided opinions from team on how things should look etc. anything you can think of, and once again, can be multiple!
